body: Sorry @TechHypeXP, your pull request is larger than the review limit of 150000 diff characters

**Summary:** This PR primarily adds documentation, developer scripts, an ESLint restriction on relative imports, and minor refactors (import path corrections); the only functional change in the booking page comments out a hardcoded OTP call, reducing risk.

**Risk:** Low risk. No new public endpoints, authentication/authorization changes, or external integrations are introduced, and runtime code paths do not weaken security boundaries or XSS protections; development scripts and markdown do not affect production execution.

**Actionable comments posted: 8**

ðŸ”‡ Additional comments (4)
src/services/sms/engine.ts (1)
`2-2`: **LGTM! Import path correctly uses path alias.** The import has been updated to use the `@/` path alias instead of a relative path, aligning with the project's new ESLint no-restricted-imports rule and tsconfig.json path mappings.
src/components/VehicleCard.tsx (1)
`26-26`: **LGTM! Import path correctly uses path alias.** The BrandLogo import has been updated to use the `@/` path alias instead of a relative `./` path, consistent with the new ESLint rule enforcing path aliases.
tsconfig.json (1)
`3-7`: **LGTM! Formatting improvements enhance readability.** The multi-line formatting for `lib`, `paths`, `include`, and `exclude` arrays improves maintainability and makes it easier to see each configuration value. Also applies to: 25-29, 32-40
eslint.config.js (1)
`38-48`: **No import violations foundâ€”rule is safe to merge.** The new `no-restricted-imports` rule restricts `../*` imports in favor of `@/*` path aliases. Verification shows zero violations across the codebase and `tsconfig.json` is properly configured with the path alias mapping (`@/* â†’ ./src/*`). The rule aligns with project standards and can be merged without breaking changes.
